com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell

Class TerminationStatus

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.TerminationStatus

  • public final class TerminationStatus
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the termination status of a command. Process.waitFor() is not very precisely specified, so this class encapsulates the interpretation of values returned by it. Caveat: due to the lossy encoding, it's not always possible to accurately distinguish signal and exit cases. In particular, processes that exit with a value within the interval [129, 191] will be mistaken for having been terminated by a signal. Instances are immutable.

        public int getExitCode()
        Returns the exit code of the subprocess. Undefined if exited() is false.

      • getTerminatingSignal

        public int getTerminatingSignal()
        Returns the number of the signal that terminated the process. Undefined if exited() returns true.

      • toShortString

        public java.lang.String toShortString()
        Returns a short string describing the termination status. e.g. "Exit 1" or "Hangup".
